you.name: Warren Buffett
you.description: Chairman and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway, legendary investor and philanthropist

superpowers.name: Technical Skills
superpowers.notes: Financial analysis and valuation. Reading and synthesizing vast information. Risk assessment and management

superpowers.name: Business Skills
superpowers.notes: Value investing and market analysis. Insurance and float management. Capital allocation expertise

superpowers.name: Organization Skills
superpowers.notes: Folksy communication making complex concepts accessible. Long-term thinking and patience. Shareholder communication

mentees.name: Todd Combs
mentees.notes: One of my potential successors who I'm training in value investing and capital allocation.
mentees.whatYouTeach: Value investing principles, reading financial statements, and patience in investing
mentees.whatYouLearn: Modern financial instruments and technology sector dynamics

mentees.name: Ted Weschler
mentees.notes: Won charity auctions to have lunch with me, impressed me so much I hired him.
mentees.whatYouTeach: Portfolio management, understanding business moats, and long-term thinking
mentees.whatYouLearn: Healthcare sector expertise and modern portfolio analysis techniques

mentees.name: Tracy Britt Cool
mentees.role: Former Berkshire executive, now CEO of Kanbrick
mentees.notes: Harvard grad who became my financial assistant and learned to run companies.
mentees.whatYouTeach: Business operations, capital allocation, and CEO mentorship
mentees.whatYouLearn: Millennial perspectives on business and modern management techniques

goals.description: Complete analysis and acquisition of a major insurance company to expand Berkshire's float and investment capital
Position Berkshire's portfolio for inflation protection while maintaining our value investing principles and finding elephant-sized acquisitions
Ensure smooth succession planning while continuing to compound wealth at 15%+ annually and fulfill my Giving Pledge commitments

mentors.name: Benjamin Graham
mentors.role: Father of value investing and foundational mentor
mentors.whatToLearn: Security analysis, margin of safety principle, and emotional discipline in investing
mentors.whatTheyGet: Validation of theories and pride in student's success
mentors.notes: Strong - professor at Columbia and later employer. His book 'The Intelligent Investor' changed my life - Chapter 8 on market fluctuations and Chapter 20 on margin of safety remain my investing foundation Meeting pattern: Weekly during employment, annual visits until his passing

mentors.name: Philip Fisher
mentors.role: Growth investing pioneer and strategic mentor
mentors.whatToLearn: Scuttlebutt method of research, importance of management quality, and holding great companies forever
mentors.whatTheyGet: Integration of growth principles with value investing and expanded influence on investment philosophy
mentors.notes: Moderate - occasional meetings and correspondence. His emphasis on qualitative factors and holding periods transformed my approach from cigar-butt investing to buying wonderful companies at fair prices Meeting pattern: Annual meetings and quarterly letter exchanges

coaches.name: Charlie Munger
coaches.role: Vice Chairman of Berkshire and intellectual sparring partner
coaches.whatToLearn: Mental models, multidisciplinary thinking, and the psychology of human misjudgment
coaches.whatTheyGet: Platform for ideas and shared journey in building Berkshire
coaches.notes: Strong - best friend and business partner for over 60 years. He made me move from buying fair companies at wonderful prices to buying wonderful companies at fair prices - transforming Berkshire's entire strategy Meeting pattern: Daily phone calls and weekly in-person meetings

coaches.name: Tom Murphy
coaches.role: Capital Cities/ABC CEO and business operations coach
coaches.whatToLearn: Operational excellence, decentralized management, and media business dynamics
coaches.whatTheyGet: Investment capital and strategic advice on major decisions
coaches.notes: Strong - close friend and board member. The best business manager I've ever met - his decentralized approach influenced how I structure Berkshire's subsidiaries Meeting pattern: Monthly calls and quarterly board meetings

sponsors.name: Katherine Graham
sponsors.role: Washington Post publisher and board position sponsor
sponsors.whatToLearn: Media industry dynamics, handling public criticism, and courage in leadership
sponsors.whatTheyGet: Business guidance during challenging times and investor credibility
sponsors.notes: Strong - served on Post board and personal friend. Her courage during Watergate and business acumen taught me about principled leadership, and she provided credibility in media circles Meeting pattern: Monthly during board service, quarterly social meetings

sponsors.name: Bill Gates Sr.
sponsors.role: Gates Foundation co-chair and philanthropy sponsor
sponsors.whatToLearn: Structured philanthropy, foundation management, and social impact measurement
sponsors.whatTheyGet: Major funding commitments and credibility for philanthropic initiatives
sponsors.notes: Strong - partner in giving pledge initiatives. His work helped structure my giving pledge and showed me how to apply business principles to philanthropy Meeting pattern: Quarterly foundation meetings and annual strategic sessions

connectors.name: Bill Gates
connectors.role: Microsoft founder and bridge to technology world
connectors.whatToLearn: Technology trends, innovation dynamics, and next-generation business models
connectors.whatTheyGet: Investment philosophy, business wisdom, and life perspective
connectors.notes: Strong - close friend and bridge partner. He helps me understand technology investments I might otherwise avoid, and our friendship bridges the old and new economy Meeting pattern: Annual trips, quarterly calls, and regular bridge games

connectors.name: Jamie Dimon
connectors.role: JPMorgan Chase CEO and financial industry connector
connectors.whatToLearn: Modern banking dynamics, regulatory environment, and global financial trends
connectors.whatTheyGet: Long-term perspective on markets and validation of strategies
connectors.notes: Strong - professional respect and regular interaction. His operational excellence in banking provides insights for our insurance operations and financial sector investments Meeting pattern: Quarterly industry meetings and annual Berkshire meetings

connectors.name: Carol Loomis
connectors.whatToLearn: Clear communication, media dynamics, and public perception management
connectors.whatTheyGet: Exclusive insights and access for stories
connectors.notes: Strong - longtime friend and editor of annual letters. Her editing of my annual letters ensures my ideas reach shareholders clearly, and her media connections help manage Berkshire's image Meeting pattern: Weekly during letter writing, monthly social meetings

peers.name: George Soros
peers.role: Hedge fund manager and different investment philosophy peer
peers.whatToLearn: Reflexivity theory, macro trading, and alternative investment approaches
peers.whatTheyGet: Perspective on long-term value investing and market psychology
peers.notes: Weak - philosophical opposites with mutual respect. His trading approach is opposite to mine, but his success proves there are multiple paths to investment success Meeting pattern: Annual industry events and rare private discussions

peers.name: Carl Icahn
peers.role: Activist investor and corporate raider peer
peers.whatToLearn: Activist strategies, corporate governance pressure tactics, and confrontational negotiation
peers.whatTheyGet: Validation of long-term approach and occasional investment ideas
peers.notes: Moderate - different approaches but mutual respect. His aggressive activism contrasts with my friendly acquisitions, but we both seek undervalued assets Meeting pattern: Bi-annual encounters at investment conferences

peers.name: Ray Dalio
peers.role: Bridgewater founder and systematic investing peer
peers.whatToLearn: Systematic decision-making, radical transparency, and macroeconomic frameworks
peers.whatTheyGet: Value investing insights and simplicity in complex markets
peers.notes: Moderate - intellectual exchange on investment principles. His principles-based approach resonates, though his complexity contrasts with my simplicity preference Meeting pattern: Annual meetings and occasional principle discussions

peers.name: Jack Bogle
peers.role: Vanguard founder and index investing peer
peers.whatToLearn: Index fund dynamics, fee compression effects, and investor behavior at scale
peers.whatTheyGet: Validation of passive investing and respect from active management legend
peers.notes: Strong - mutual admiration despite different approaches. I regularly recommend index funds for most investors - his innovation democratized investing despite my active approach Meeting pattern: Annual shareholder meetings and regular correspondence
